segments.text: As a matter of fact, the real cause of that row was Peter Burden.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: There was nothing in that, you know that.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I knew nothing of the sort.  You took presents from him.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Presents a trivial little broach.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I remember it well bristling with diamonds in the worst possible taste.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Not at all.  It was very pretty.  I still have it and I wear it often.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You went out of your way to torture me over Peter Burden.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I did not.  You made the whole thing up in your jealous imagination.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You must admit that he was in love with you, wasn't he?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Just a little perhaps, nothing serious.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You let him kiss you.  You said you did.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: What of it?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What of it?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It gave him a lot of pleasure and it didn't hurt me.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What about me?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: If you hadn't been so nosey, you never would have known a thing about it.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: That's a nice point of view, I must say.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh, dear.  I'm bored with this conversation.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: So am I.  Bored stiff.  Want some brandy?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No thanks.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I'll have some myself, I think.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I don't see why you want it.  You've already had two glasses.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: No particular reason.  Anyway they were very small ones.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: seems so silly to go on and on and on with such a thing.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You can hardly call three liquor glasses in the whole evening going on and on and on.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It's become a habit with you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You needn't be so grand just because you don't happen to want any at the moment.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh, don't be so stupid.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Really, Amanda.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: What?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Nothing.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Going somewhere, my dear?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Just making myself fascinating for you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Ah, that reply has broken my heart.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: The woman's job is to allure the man.  Watch me a minute will you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: As a matter of fact, that's perfectly true.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh, no it isn't
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yes, it is.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh, be quiet.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: It's a pity you don't have anymore brandy.  It might have made you a little less disagreeable.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It doesn't seem to have worked such wonders with you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Snap, snap, snap like a little adder.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Adders don't snap they sting.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Non-sense they have bags of venom behind their fangs and they snap.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: They sting.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: They snap.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I don't care, okay.  Do you understand?  I don't care.  I don't mind if they bark and roll about like hoops.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Did you see much of Peter Burden after our divorce?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yes, I did quite a lot.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I suppose you let him kiss you a good deal more then.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Mind your own business.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You must have had a riotous time.  No restraint at all, very enjoyable, you never had much anyhow.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You're quite insufferable.  I expect it's because you're drunk.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I'm not in the least drunk.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You always had a weak head.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I think I mentioned once before that I had three minute liquor glasses of brandy the whole evening long.  A child of two couldn't get drunk on that.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: On, the contrary.  A child of two could get violently drunk on only one glass of brandy.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Very interesting and how about a child of six and a child of four and a child of nine.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh, shut up.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: They'd get up a splendid little debate about that, you know.  Intemperate tots.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Not very funny, dear.  You'd better have some more brandy.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Very good idea.  I will.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You'd better turn that off I think.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Why?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: It's very late and it will annoy the people upstairs.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: There is no one upstairs.  It's a photographer's studio.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: There are people downstairs I suppose.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: They're away in Tunis.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: This is no time of year for Tunis.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Turn it on again, please.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I'll do no such thing.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Very well if you insist on being boorish and idiotic.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Turn it off.  It's driving me mad.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You're far too temperamental.  Try to control yourself.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Turn it off.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Go away, go away.  I hate you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Amanda, listen.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Listen? Listen indeed.  I'm sick and tired of listening to you.  You damn sadistic bully.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Stop.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Very amusing.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Stop, stop.  I hate you.  Do you hear?  You're conceited and overbearing and utterly impossible.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You're a vile tempered, loose living, wicked little beast. And I hope I never see you again as long as I live.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: This is the end do you understand?  The end,
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You're not going like this.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: finally and forever
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh, I am.  Let go of me.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You're not.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh, I hate you. It's a good thing that I found out in time what you're really like. Marry you again?  Never, never, never.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Shut up.  Shut up. I wouldn't marry you again if you came crawling to me on your bended knees.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You're a mean, evil minded, little tempered witch. I hope to God I never set eyes on you again as long as I live. Whore.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I'd rather die in torment. Beast.  Brute.  Calf swine.
segments.speaker: F
